title: Tropical Storm Debby | Gulf waters could help slow - moving TS Debby strengthen into Category 1 hurricane before landfall
message:
Tropical Storm Debby expected to strengthen to Category 1 hurricane; rains could set records: LIVETropical Storm Debby is now forecast to rapidly intensify into a hurricane before it makes landfall in Florida's Big Bend region and brings potentially historic amounts of rainfall to parts of the Southeast, due to near-record warm waters in the Gulf of Mexico.
It could become a hurricane by Sunday evening after being upgraded to a tropical storm a day prior, according to the National Hurricane Center.
Tropical Storm Debby is rapidly strengthening as it moves through the Gulf of Mexico toward Florida.
Despite landfall being only between 12 to 18 hours away, the hurricane center warned Debby will undergo "significant strengthening before landfall."
"This rainfall will likely result in areas of considerable flash and urban flooding, with significant river flooding expected," the National Hurricane Center said.

title: Dramatic photos show flooding in Florida as  life threatening  Tropical Storm Debby barrels through state and threatens to turn into hurricane
message:
A tropical storm set to make landfall as a hurricane has already brought flooding to Florida's Gulf Coast.
Tropical Storm Debby brought at least two feet of storm surge to southwest cities like Fort Myers, with photos showing cars there completely underwater.
'Please do not be lulled into any false sense of security that Debby is presently rated as a tropical storm.

Citizens in areas set to be affected are advised to stay indoors.

title: What is storm surge ?
message:
TAMPA, Fla. (WFLA) — As Florida anticipates the arrival of Tropical Storm Debby, which will likely strengthen into a hurricane before reaching landfall Monday morning, the National Hurricane Center is issuing lots of warnings, including storm surge.
Tropical Storm Debby strengthening, expected to become hurricaneAccording to the NHC, storm surge is abnormal rising water, generated from storms, that move inland from the shoreline.
Storm Surge WarningA warning indicated that there is dangerous, life-threatening inundation from rising waters, usually within 36 hours.
TIMELINE: When Tropical Storm Debby will impact the Tampa Bay areaFactors impacting storm surgeThe NHC said storm surge is sensitive to the slightest changes and can be impacted by several factors.
Storm intensity- Higher wind speeds = Higher storm surgeForward speed- Faster storm = Higher surge at coastline, Slower storm = Surge goes further inlandSize- Larger storm = Higher surgeAngle of Approach- Perpendicular to coast = Higher storm surge, Parallel or oblique = lower storm surgeWidth and Slope of Ocean Bottom- Wide, gentle slope = Higher storm surge, Narrow, steep slope = Lower storm surgeShape of Coastline- Concave coastlines (curved inward) = Higher storm surge, Convex coastline (curved outward) = Lower storm surgeDo you know of something newsworthy happening in your community?

title: Debby to Slam Into Florida , Touching Off a Week of Disaster
message:
(Bloomberg) -- Tropical Storm Debby will strengthen into a hurricane overnight as it nears a Monday landfall in Florida’s Big Bend region, where residents have fled ahead of a potential weeklong disaster across the South.
Florida Governor Ron DeSantis and Georgia Governor Brian Kemp have declared emergencies in their states as Debby moves north.
Debby is 2024’s fourth storm and will be the second hurricane to hit the US this year.
A year ago, Hurricane Idalia made landfall in the Big Bend area as a Category 3 hurricane.
Its onshore winds will push water into the coastline and prevent local rivers from draining flooding rains from the interior, Rinde said.

title: Tropical Storm Debby to slam Florida Big Bend as a hurricane Monday – Daily Breeze
message:
Tropical Storm Debby will rip into Florida’s Big Bend as a hurricane on Monday as it continues to increase in strength crossing the eastern Gulf of Mexico, forcing residents in the area to evacuate and potentially causing $1 billion in damages and losses across the South.
“This is a life-threatening situation,” John Cangialosi, a senior hurricane specialist at the center, wrote in his forecast.
Debby is 2024’s fourth storm and will be the second hurricane to hit the US this year.
A year ago, Hurricane Idalia made landfall in the Big Bend area as a Category 3 hurricane.
Warm ocean water across the Caribbean and Gulf has raised the alarm this will be a very active Atlantic storm season.

title: Tropical Storm Debby expected to strengthen rapidly near Florida – NBC 6 South Florida
message:
Tropical Storm Debby is strengthening over the Gulf of Mexico, as it sits about 120 west of Tampa at this time.
Debby moved across western Cuba on Saturday as a depression before it reached the eastern Gulf of Mexico, where it reached tropical storm status, the NHC said.
Tropical storm watches and warnings in The Keys have been discontinued.
"This rainfall will likely result in areas of locally considerable flash and urban flooding, with river flooding expected," the NHC said.
It’ll be hot and humid through the area today when we are not seeing any of the tropical rain.

title: Sarasota - Manatee live updates : Tropical Storm Debby passes due west of Sarasota , Bradenton
message:
In 2012, Sarasota was hit by another Tropical Storm Debby that flooded streets, damaged roofs and sank boats.
(Read yesterday's Tropical Storm Debby live blog here.)
According to a Sarasota County update:Residential solid waste collection for residents living in unincorporated Sarasota County will continue as scheduled on Monday, Aug. 5.
8 a.m. National Hurricane Center update as Tropical Storm Debby almost due west of Sarasota, BradentonThe projected path of Tropical Storm Debby as of 8 a.m., August 4.
Sarasota and Manatee counties remain under a Tropical Storm Warning and Storm Surge Watch as Tropical Storm Debby passes due west of the area.

title: Tropical Storm Debby moving through Gulf toward Florida with hurricane warnings
message:
Meanwhile, wind and thunderstorms have spread over a broad area including southern Florida, the Florida Keys and the Bahamas.
Debby is the fourth named storm of the 2024 Atlantic hurricane season after Tropical Storm Alberto, Hurricane Beryl and Tropical Storm Chris, all of which formed in June.
A tropical storm watch extended farther west into the Panhandle.
Forecasters warned of "a danger of life-threatening storm surge inundation" in a region that includes Hernando Beach, Crystal River, Steinhatchee and Cedar Key.
We're doing everything that we need to be prepared to face a tropical storm," Tampa Mayor Jane Castor said.

title: Town of James Island moves to OPCON 2 ahead of Tropical Storm Debby
message:
JAMES ISLAND, S.C. (WCBD) – The Town of James Island has moved to OPCON 2, aligning with Charleston County, as Tropical Storm Debby approaches.
Town officials are coordinating with County Emergency Management and other partners to prepare for the storm.
The National Weather Service warns that Debby will bring “historic” levels of rain and flooding, starting Monday morning and intensifying through mid-week.
City of Charleston updates residents on Tropical Storm DebbyCharleston County advises residents in low-lying and flood-prone areas to consider relocating due to the potential for prolonged flooding.
Latest Weather: For the most accurate weather forecasts, residents should monitor the National Hurricane Center and National Weather Service Charleston websites, local media, and the SCEMD’s SC Emergency Manager app.

title: Tropical Storm Debby to strengthen to Category 1 hurricane before Florida landfall
message:
Tropical Storm Debby is forecast to strengthen into a hurricane before it makes landfall in Florida’s Big Bend region early Monday, the National Weather Service predicted.
Meteorologists predicted that the storm will track slowly over northern Florida, Georgia, and South Carolina on Monday and Tuesday, bringing substantial rain and severe weather risks.
The storm is likely to become a hurricane overnight before making landfall early Monday morning, forecasters said, with winds as strong as 85 mph.
Meteorologists warned of extreme flooding risks due to Debby’s expected slow speed over land, including “potentially historic” rainfall across southeast Georgia and South Carolina through Friday.
The storm will become the second hurricane of the season after Hurricane Beryl became the earliest Category 5 hurricane in history in late June and early July.

title: Florida braces for Debbie , expected to land in North Florida as a hurricane on Monday
message:
Florida braces for Debby, expected to land in North Florida as a hurricane on MondayGov.
Ron DeSantis warned residents Sunday to complete preparations for the arrival of Tropical Storm Debby, which has been forecast to hit the Big Bend area Monday morning with hurricane-force winds.
Hurricane Ian, Category Four, did the same in Southwest Florida on Sept. 28, 2022, and caused extensive flooding through peninsular Florida.
The Florida National Guard has deployed as many as 3,000 servicemembers and the Florida State Guard 70 members.
This story has been updated to correct the name of Tropical Storm Debby.

title: Gov . McMaster declares State of Emergency for South Carolina
message:
COLUMBIA, S.C. (WCBD) – Governor Henry McMaster today issued Executive Order 2024-16, declaring a State of Emergency in preparation for the potential effects of Tropical Storm Debby.
The executive order activates the South Carolina Emergency Operations Plan, enabling all state agencies to coordinate resources efficiently.
City of Charleston discusses storm preparations ahead of potential Tropical Storm Debby impacts“Team South Carolina is closely monitoring Tropical Storm Debby and has begun preparing for its potential impact on our state,” said Governor McMaster.
South Carolina residents and visitors in vulnerable areas are urged to review their emergency plans and consider necessary actions should the storm threaten their safety.
The South Carolina Emergency Management Division (SCEMD) offers several resources for hurricane preparedness, including an interactive tool available at hurricane.sc.

title: OFFICIALLY DEBBY : Tropical Storm Debby Forms in Southeastern Gulf
message:
ALBANY, Ga. (WALB) - Tropical Storm Debby continues her steady northward progress this afternoon through the eastern Gulf of Mexico just off the western coast of Florida.
The storm is forecast to become a hurricane this evening, making landfall along the Florida Big Bend coast Monday morning as a Category 1 storm.
Locally, a hurricane warning has now been issued for Brooks, Lanier, and Lowndes counties, with tropical storm warnings now in effect for Decatur, Grady, Thomas, Mitchell, Colquitt, Worth, Turner, Tift, Cook, Ben Hill, Irwin, Berrien, Coffee, Atkinson, Clinch, and Echols counties.
Tropical storm watches are now in effect for Lee and Dougherty counties as well as Baker, Miller, Crisp, and Seminole.
Tropical storm conditions may begin to overspread those areas as early as overnight tonight into Monday morning.

title: Charleston County moves to OPCON 2 , activates Emergency Operations Center in preparation for Tropical Storm Debby
message:
CHARLESTON, S.C.(WCBD) – Charleston County has shifted to OPCON 2 and partially activated its Emergency Operations Center as officials prepare for the impacts of Tropical Storm Debby.
The storm system is forecasted to reach the Charleston area on Monday morning, bringing historic levels of rain and flooding throughout the week.
According to the National Weather Service, the region can expect 20 to 30 inches of rain and strong tropical storm-force winds.
Tropical storm and storm surge warnings are currently in effect for Charleston County.
Residents are also encouraged to check and clear any obstructions from storm drains near their homes ahead of the storm’s onset.

title: Hurricane warning issued as Tropical Storm Debby takes shape ; potential to impact East Coast
message:
STATEN ISLAND, N.Y. -- Tropical Storm Debby has taken shape in the Gulf and will continue to strengthen as it moves north toward Florida, AccuWeather said Saturday.
A hurricane warning has been issued for the Big Bend area of the Florida coast between the Suwannee River and the Ochlockonee River, according to AccuWeather.
As this feature approaches the Big Bend of Florida early Monday, further intensification to a Category 1 hurricane can occur,” AccuWeather lead hurricane expert Alex DaSilva said.
There is the potential for Debby to rapidly intensify into a Category 2 hurricane before making landfall Sunday night or Monday morning along the shores of Apalachee Bay, Florida, AccuWeather said.
Regardless of whether or not the storm has a direct impact with the Northeast, AccuWeather indicates that tropical moisture may interact with a non-tropical storm, which could prompt flooding and rainfall in the Northeast sometime between Tuesday and Thursday.

title: Debby Expected To Reach Hurricane Strength Before Landfall
message:
(Tampa, FL) -- Tropical Storm Debby is expected to intensify into a category one hurricane when it makes landfall.
The National Hurricane Center says the storm is expected to hit the coast of Florida by Sunday night or early Monday.
A turn toward the north is expected on Sunday, followed by a slower motion toward the northeast on Monday and Tuesday.
On the forecast track, the center will move across the eastern Gulf of Mexico through Sunday night and reach the Florida Big Bend coast Monday morning.
The center is then expected to move slowly across northern Florida and southern Georgia Monday and Tuesday.

message:

title: Tropical Storm Debby on path to impacts parts of Georgia damaged by Hurricane Idalia
message:
Tropical Storm Debby on path to impacts parts of Georgia damaged by Hurricane IdaliaTropical Storm Debby is expected to impact parts of South Georgia that were damaged about the same time last year by Hurricane Idalia.
According to Severe Weather Team 2 Chief Meteorologist Brad Nitz, Debby could bring historical levels of flooding to parts of South Georgia, with 10-20 inches of rain falling by the time the storm passes.
While the Debby is still currently a tropical storm, it could strengthen to a Category 1 hurricane by the time it makes landfall in the Big Bend of Florida.
It will then move into South Georgia sometime between Monday and Tuesday.
RELATED STORIES:About the same time last year, Hurricane Idalia barreled through the same area causing “significant damage” to Valdosta.

title: Dramatic Images Show Flooding In Florida As Tropical Storm Debby , Threatening To Become A Hurricane , Moves Through The State And Threatens To Become Deadly
message:
A tropical storm preparing to make landfall as a hurricane has already caused flooding along Florida’s Gulf Coast.
Tropical Storm Debby brought a storm surge of at least two feet to southwestern cities like Fort Myers, with photographs showing cars there completely underwater.

title: Debby Strengthens & Expected to Reach Hurricane Strength Before Landfall
message:
(Miami, FL) -- Southwest Florida is getting hit with heavy rain as Tropical Storm Debby intensifies over the Gulf Coast.
Debby is expected to make landfall in the Florida Panhandle Monday morning as a Category One hurricane with 75-mile-an-hour winds.
The National Hurricane Center is calling it a life-threatening situation and is warning of storm surge and flooding.
Debby is then expected to move slowly across northern Florida and southern Georgia Monday and Tuesday.
Continued strengthening is forecast, and Debby is expected to become a hurricane by tonight before it reaches the Florida Big Bend coast.
